content: I have created a simple Test mathlib4 project and put some theorems inside. Trying to do a "lake build" does not work. I have also tried specifying the module and the olean extension with "lake build Mod.File1:olean" but that also does not build me the olean file. I am looking for the olean files in the directory .lake/build/lib/lean/Mod
does lake build Mod.File1 work? what error does it give you? I'm afraid "does not work" is very unspecific and makes it hard for anybody to help.

image.png

lake build Mewll2.Faifa
Build completed successfully.

As you can see no olean file in the left side.
It doesn't give me any error, it just doesn't produce the *.olean artefact.
Are you sure the oleans are missing and not just hidden by vscode?
Thanks, the thing that worried me is that lean4export didn't find the files. They are indeed there.
I have to figure out why lean4export doesn't see them
I guess this is what I'm getting uncaught exception: failed to read file '././.lake/build/lib/lean/Mewll2.olean', invalid header
@metakuntyyy What version of Lean are you using? The olean format of the latest Lean has changed since the last lean4export update.
This issue was resolved with the help of @Mario Carneiro . I am very appreciative of that
metakuntyyy has marked this topic as resolved.
